results.adx_keywords: Hedge Funds;internal-sub-only;Banking and Financial Institutions;internal-great-read;Dalio, Raymond (1949- );Bridgewater Associates
results.title: How Does the World’s Largest Hedge Fund Really Make Its Money?
results.abstract: Ray Dalio’s investing tactics have always been a closely kept secret, even inside Bridgewater Associates. Several years ago, some of Wall Street’s biggest names set out to discover his edge.

media.caption: Since founding Bridgewater in his Manhattan apartment in 1975, Ray Dalio has been said to have developed prodigious skill at spotting, and making money from, big-picture global economic or political changes.
media.copyright: Xinhua News Agency, via Getty Images

results.title: For Europe’s Jews, a World of Fear
results.abstract: The Oct. 7 Hamas assault on Israel and a surge in acts of antisemitism have awakened a repressed horror in Jewish populations across the continent.

results.adx_keywords: Birds;Names, Personal;Discrimination;Birdwatching;your-feed-science;Audubon, John James;Cooper, Christian (Birder);American Ornithological Society;Audubon Society, National;North America;South America
results.title: Birds in the Americas Will No Longer Be Named After People
results.abstract: The American Ornithological Society has committed to replacing all bird names derived from people so as not to honor figures with racist pasts.

media.caption: The bird soon to be formerly known as a Wilson’s warbler. Changing its name to something like black-capped warbler would give birders a better idea of what to look for, said Christian Cooper, a birder and television host.

results.title: House Blocks Censure of Tlaib on Charge of Antisemitism
results.abstract: A solid bloc of Republicans joined Democrats in refusing to back a move to formally rebuke Representative Rashida Tlaib of Michigan, a far-left Democrat, for her harsh criticism of Israel.

media.caption: Representative Rashida Tlaib, Democrat of Michigan, is the only Palestinian American member of Congress.

media.caption: Former President Donald Trump’s lawyers have sought to push the start of the trial until after Election Day.

results.title: Bobby Knight, Basketball Coach Known for Trophies and Tantrums, Dies at 83
results.abstract: Knight raised Indiana to the national top tier while upholding academic standards, but he was notorious for the rage he directed at players and referees.

media.caption: Bobby Knight, a volatile but brilliant college basketball coach, was among American sport’s most polarizing characters.

results.title: Is the Pantyhose-as-Pants Look a Real Thing?
results.abstract: A reader who sees pants-less celebrities on runways and on social media wonders if the rest of us are actually expected to follow suit.

media.caption: Kendall Jenner stepping out in black pantyhose. The no-pants look has made a comeback at runway shows for Bottega Veneta and Miu Miu, and on celebrities including Emma Corrin and Rihanna.

results.title: Leah Remini Lists Her Los Angeles Home a Third Time
results.abstract: Ms. Remini, the actress now known as an outspoken critic against the Church of Scientology, is asking for $12.5 million for the six-bedroom house she bought 20 years ago.

media.caption: The grounds of Ms. Remini’s Studio City home include a dance studio and a swimming pool flanked by mature trees and a stone hardscape for lounging.

results.title: Trump 14th Amendment Disqualification Trial Can Continue, Judge Rules
results.abstract: Former President Donald J. Trump’s team had argued that his words and actions leading up to the attack on the Capitol were protected by the First Amendment, and asked that the Colorado case be thrown out.
